summary: VIPbansal branded website for R2S Sports Champion Pro ‚Äî a multi-sports gaming platform featuring Cricket, Football, Basketball, Racing, Badminton, and Shooting. Includes game listings, leaderboard, R2S Play & Earn page, mini cricket game, privacy policy, and VIPbansal/R2S branding throughout.
architectural_notes: Website for VIPbansal brand focused on Android sports games
Admin role required: a designated principal/address should have admin privileges to manage users, passwords, and platform controls.
User data model includes: userId, name, email, coins (USDT/IRN denominations), and role (user/admin). Admin role identified by username 'survesh1'.
Withdrawal requests data model: requestId, userId, amount (‚Çπ100/‚Çπ100000), upiId, status (pending/approved). Admin panel manages withdrawal approvals.
Sport categories include: Cricket, Football, Basketball, Racing, Badminton, Shooting.

existing_features.title: Create a visually bold sports gaming homepage with VIPbansal branding, featuring a hero banner with the brand name, a tagline, and featured sports game highlights. Apply a dark, energetic theme with vibrant accent colors (red/gold/black) inspired by premium sports and gaming aesthetics. Use bold typography and dynamic layout consistently across all pages.

Build an Android Sports Games listing page showing game cards. Each card displays the game name, sport category (e.g., Cricket, Football, Basketball, Tennis), a thumbnail image, a short description, and a 'Play Now' button. Games data should be stored in the backend and fetched on the frontend.

Implement a Leaderboard/Scoreboard section that displays top players with their username, score, rank, and sport category. The backend should store player score entries and expose endpoints to add a score and retrieve the top scores sorted by highest score.
Add a persistent navigation bar with the VIPbansal logo/brand name, links to Home, Games, and Leaderboard sections, and a mobile-friendly hamburger menu for smaller screens.

Create a Sign Up page at route /signup where users can register by providing a username and email. On submission, call the backend registerUser endpoint using the authenticated Internet Identity principal. Display success confirmation and redirect to the home page after registration.

Create a Login page at route /login that triggers Internet Identity authentication via the existing useInternetIdentity hook. After successful login, redirect the user to their previous page or the home page. Display the authenticated user's username in the Navbar when logged in, and replace the login link with a logout button.

Create a Password Reset page at route /reset-password. Since authentication is handled by Internet Identity (which does not use passwords), this page should clearly explain that account security is managed by Internet Identity and guide users to the Internet Identity portal (https://identity.ic0.app) to manage their devices and recovery methods. Provide a clear CTA button linking to the Internet Identity portal.

Update the Navbar and App router to include navigation links for Login and Sign Up when the user is unauthenticated, and show the username with a Logout button when authenticated. Add routes for /login, /signup, and /reset-password to the TanStack Router configuration in App.tsx.

Create a protected Admin Panel page at route /admin in the frontend. The page is only accessible when the authenticated Internet Identity principal matches the admin principal returned by the backend isAdmin check. If the user is not the admin, show an 'Access Denied' message. The admin panel must include: (1) a Users tab listing all registered users (username, email, principal) with options to edit profile fields or delete a user; (2) a Scores tab listing all leaderboard entries with the ability to delete individual score records; (3) clear success/error feedback for all admin actions.

Add a link to the Admin Panel (/admin) in the Navbar that is only visible when the authenticated user is the admin (as determined by the isAdmin backend call). The link should appear alongside the existing authenticated navigation controls.

Update all game cards in the backend and Games page so that each game has a real, working external game URL. The 'Play Now' button on each GameCard must open the game's URL in a new browser tab (target='_blank'). Pre-populate the backend with real sports game entries (Cricket, Football, Basketball, Tennis) that include valid game URLs pointing to popular free online sports games (e.g., cricketgames.io, miniclip.com football games, etc.).

Add a sport category filter bar to the Games page (/games). Display filter buttons for All, Cricket, Football, Basketball, and Tennis. Clicking a category button filters the displayed game cards to only show games of that category. The active filter button should be visually highlighted using the existing gold/red brand colors.

Make the Leaderboard page fully live and interactive. Ensure the score submission form is prominently visible, functional, and allows any user (authenticated or guest) to submit a score with a username, score value, and sport category. The leaderboard table must auto-refresh after a score is submitted to show the latest rankings. Add a 'Refresh' button to manually reload the leaderboard.

Polish the overall UI to feel like a real, professional online gaming platform. Apply the following enhancements: (1) Add animated hover effects on game cards (scale up, glow border in gold/red); (2) Add a 'Featured Games' horizontal scroll section on the Home page showcasing 4‚Äì6 highlighted games fetched from the backend; (3) Add a live 'Top Player' badge or ticker on the Home page showing the current leaderboard #1 player; (4) Add smooth page transition animations between routes; (5) Add a loading progress bar at the top of the page while data is being fetched.

Create a new page at route /otp-login that provides a two-step mobile OTP authentication UI. Step 1: Display a phone number input field (placeholder: 'Enter Mobile Number') and a 'Send OTP' button. Step 2: After the user enters their phone number and clicks 'Send OTP', show an OTP input field (placeholder: 'Enter OTP') and a 'Verify' button. Since the Internet Computer does not support SMS gateways, the OTP flow must be simulated on the frontend ‚Äî generate a random 6-digit OTP, display it visibly on screen (e.g., in an info box labeled 'Your OTP: XXXXXX') for the user to copy and enter, then verify it client-side. On successful OTP verification, show a success message. Style the page consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme.

Create a new page at route /r2s-game titled 'R2S Play & Earn'. The page must include: (1) a Score counter initialized to 0; (2) a Coins counter initialized to 0; (3) a cricket game area featuring an animated ball that moves horizontally across the game box; (4) a 'Hit Shot üèè' button ‚Äî each click increments the score by 6 and awards 1 coin; (5) a 'Withdraw' button that shows a modal or inline message informing the user that withdrawals are not yet available (simulated UI only). All game state (score, coins) is managed in React component state on the frontend only ‚Äî no backend persistence required.

Add a navigation link to the R2S Play & Earn page (/r2s-game) in the Navbar alongside the existing navigation links (Home, Games, Leaderboard). Register the /r2s-game route in the TanStack Router configuration in App.tsx.

Update the R2S Play & Earn page (/r2s-game) so that each 'Hit Shot üèè' button click awards a random number of runs between 0 and 6 (inclusive) instead of a fixed value. Add the random runs to the score counter and award coins at a rate of 2 coins per run earned (e.g., 6 runs = 12 coins). Display both the Score and Coins counters prominently.

Update the Withdraw button on the R2S Play & Earn page so that it enforces a minimum of 1000 coins. If the user has fewer than 1000 coins, show an error message stating 'Minimum 1000 coins required!'. If the user has 1000 or more coins, show a success message stating 'Withdraw Successful! ‚Çπ10 Sent (Demo)' and deduct 1000 coins from the coins counter.

Add a 'Tap & Earn üí∞' mode section to the R2S Play & Earn page. Include a 'Tap Me üí∞' button that awards +5 coins per tap. Display a separate tap-coins counter (or add to the existing coins counter) so users can see their accumulated tap earnings. Style the tap button consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme.

Add a user profile info panel to the R2S Play & Earn page displaying the following static/demo fields: User ID (161056834), Name (Bansal), Username (surajkumar), Referral Code (survesh16), Total Earning ($100,000,000), and Coins denominated in USDT and IRN. This is a display-only UI panel ‚Äî no backend persistence is required. Style it consistently with the dark VIPbansal theme.

Add a WhatsApp contact link to the R2S Play & Earn page. Display a 'Message us on WhatsApp' call-to-action button or link that opens https://wa.me/918827991871 in a new browser tab. Style it with a WhatsApp-green color and place it in a visible location on the page (e.g., footer of the game page or sidebar).

Update the frontend user profile display on the R2S Play & Earn page (/r2s-game) to show the extended profile fields from REQ-26: userId (161056834), name (survesh bansal), username (surajkumar), email (mjkjbansal@gmail.com), role, and coins displayed in both USDT and IRN denominations. These values should reflect the demo/static data consistent with the backend seed record.

Add a 'Withdraw Requests' tab to the existing Admin Panel page (/admin). This tab must: (1) fetch and display all withdraw requests from the backend getAllWithdrawRequests endpoint in a table with columns: Request ID, User ID, Amount, UPI ID, Status; (2) provide an 'Approve' button for each pending request that calls approveWithdrawRequest and updates the status to 'Approved'; (3) provide a 'Delete' button for each request that calls deleteWithdrawRequest and removes it from the list; (4) show clear success/error feedback for all actions. The tab must only be accessible to the admin (consistent with the existing isAdmin guard on the Admin Panel).

Update the R2S Play & Earn page (/r2s-game) to include a Withdraw Request form. When the user clicks the 'Withdraw' button and meets the 1000-coin minimum, display a form (or modal) prompting the user to enter their UPI ID and select an amount (‚Çπ100 or ‚Çπ100000). On submission, call the backend submitWithdrawRequest endpoint with the user's userId, chosen amount, and UPI ID. Show a success confirmation message with the returned requestId after submission. If the user has fewer than 1000 coins, continue showing the existing 'Minimum 1000 coins required!' error without showing the form.

Enhance the cricket game area on the R2S Play & Earn page (/r2s-game) to make it fully playable. Implement an interactive batting mechanic where the animated ball moves horizontally (and optionally vertically) across the game area, and the user must click/tap the 'Hit Shot üèè' button at the right moment to hit the ball. Add visual feedback for each shot (e.g., a bat swing animation, ball trajectory change, runs popup showing the runs scored '6!', '4!', 'OUT!', etc.). Include a wickets/lives counter (e.g., 3 wickets) ‚Äî if the user misses the ball (clicks too early or too late), deduct a wicket. When all wickets are lost, show a 'Game Over' screen with the final score and a 'Play Again' button that resets the game state. Award coins at the existing rate of 2 coins per run. Keep all game state (score, coins, wickets) in React component state only ‚Äî no backend persistence required.

Add a 'Live Cricket Scores' section to the R2S Play & Earn page (/r2s-game). Display a static/simulated cricket match scoreboard widget showing match details: teams (e.g., England vs India), current score, wickets, overs, result or match status (e.g., 'England won by 4 wickets'). Since live external API integrations are not supported, simulate the match data with realistic hardcoded/demo entries for multiple matches (at least 3 recent/upcoming matches). Include team names with flag emojis, score format (e.g., '245/6 in 48.2 overs'), and a match status badge ('Live', 'Result', 'Upcoming'). Style the widget consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme.

Create a new standalone Mini Cricket Game page at route /mini-cricket in the React frontend. The game must include: (1) a Score counter initialized to 0; (2) a 'Balls Left' counter initialized to 6; (3) a 'Hit Ball üèè' button ‚Äî each click picks a random integer between 0 and 6 inclusive; if the result is 0 the player is OUT (display 'OUT! üò¢'), otherwise add the runs to the score and display 'You scored X runs!'; (4) after all 6 balls are bowled, display a 'Game Over! Final Score: X' message and disable the Hit Ball button; (5) a 'Play Again' button that resets score to 0 and balls to 6. All game state must be managed in React component state only ‚Äî no backend persistence required. Style the page consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme (dark background, gold/red accents, bold typography).

Add a navigation link to the Mini Cricket Game page (/mini-cricket) in the Navbar alongside the existing navigation links (Home, Games, Leaderboard, R2S Game). Register the /mini-cricket route in the TanStack Router configuration in App.tsx.

Create a new Privacy Policy page at route /privacy-policy in the React frontend. The page must display the full privacy policy content for 'R2S Sports Champion Pro', structured with the following sections: (1) Introduction paragraph stating the app respects user privacy; (2) 'Information We Collect' with three subsections ‚Äî Personal Information (not collected unless voluntarily provided), Non-Personal Information (device type, OS, IP address, gameplay statistics, usage data), and Advertising Data (Google AdMob collects device identifiers per Google's Privacy Policy); (3) 'How We Use Information' as a bulleted list: improve game performance, fix bugs and crashes, show relevant advertisements, analyze user engagement; (4) 'Children's Privacy' ‚Äî app is not directed to children under 13, no knowingly collected personal data from children; (5) 'Data Security' ‚Äî industry-standard security measures, no system is 100% secure; (6) 'Third-Party Services' ‚Äî lists Google AdMob and Firebase Analytics with a note that they may collect information per their own privacy policies; (7) 'Changes to This Policy' ‚Äî policy may be updated and changes posted on this page; (8) 'Contact Us' section with email mjkjbansal@gmail.com; (9) 'Last Updated: 2026' footer note. Style the page consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme (dark background, gold/red section headings, bold typography, Tailwind utility classes matching the rest of the app).

Add a 'Privacy Policy' link to the Footer component (frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx) that navigates to the /privacy-policy route. Register the /privacy-policy route in the TanStack Router configuration in frontend/src/App.tsx.

Update the Games page (/games) category filter bar to include filter buttons for Racing, Badminton, and Shooting alongside the existing All, Cricket, Football, Basketball, and Tennis filters. Game cards for these new categories must render correctly using the existing GameCard component.

Update the homepage hero/about section in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx to include the R2S Sports Champion Pro app description. The section must highlight: six sports (Cricket, Football, Basketball, Racing, Badminton, Shooting) each with their emoji, smooth controls & realistic physics, offline & online play, unlock achievements and rewards, and compete with friends & global leaderboard. Use the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme and bold typography.

Create a Terms & Conditions page at route /terms in the React frontend. The page must display T&C content relevant to R2S Sports Champion Pro, structured with sections covering: (1) Acceptance of Terms; (2) Use of the App (permitted and prohibited uses); (3) User Accounts and Registration; (4) In-App Coins and Rewards (virtual currency, no real monetary value unless stated); (5) Leaderboard and Fair Play; (6) Intellectual Property; (7) Disclaimer of Warranties; (8) Limitation of Liability; (9) Changes to Terms; (10) Contact Us (email: mjkjbansal@gmail.com); (11) 'Last Updated: 2026' footer note. Style the page consistently with the existing dark red/gold VIPbansal theme (dark background, gold/red section headings, bold typography, Tailwind utility classes).

Add a 'Terms & Conditions' link to the Footer component (frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx) that navigates to the /terms route, placed alongside the existing Privacy Policy link. Register the /terms route in the TanStack Router configuration in frontend/src/App.tsx.

new_feature_requests.summary: Game listings page for Android sports games
Scoreboard/leaderboard section
VIPbansal branding and attractive UI design
Sign up, login, and password reset pages for user authentication

Add a user profile/account system to the backend that stores registered user records (principal ID, username, email) and supports retrieving a user profile by principal. Expose endpoints: registerUser (username, email), getMyProfile, and updateProfile.
Add an admin panel/role system where an admin (identified by a specific address/principal) can access all user data, manage passwords, and control the platform with elevated privileges.

Add an admin role system to the backend. Define a hardcoded admin principal (configured as a stable variable). Expose the following admin-only endpoints: (1) getAllUsers ‚Äî returns all registered user profiles; (2) deleteUser(principal) ‚Äî removes a user profile by principal; (3) updateUserProfile(principal, username, email) ‚Äî allows admin to edit any user's profile; (4) resetUserData(principal) ‚Äî clears score entries associated with a user; (5) isAdmin ‚Äî returns true if the caller is the admin principal. All admin endpoints must reject non-admin callers with an #unauthorized error.

Activate and enhance all existing settings/features to make the website feel like a real online gaming platform ‚Äî fully functional games listing, working Play Now buttons linking to real game URLs, category filters, leaderboard fully active, and overall polished real-world experience.

Update the backend game data model to include a gameUrl field (Text) for each game entry. Update the addGame and all related backend functions to accept and store this field. Ensure getGames returns the gameUrl in the response so the frontend can use it for the Play Now button.
Add mobile OTP-based authentication: phone number input with Send OTP button, OTP input with Verify button for user login/signup flow.
Add an R2S Play & Earn cricket game page with a Hit Shot button, score tracker, coin counter, and a Withdraw button.

Update R2S game: randomize runs (0-6) per play, award coins at 2x runs, require 1000 coins minimum for withdrawal (show success alert with ‚Çπ10 demo payout), add a Tap & Earn mode with +5 coins per tap, and display user profile info (userID, name, referralCode, totalEarning, USDT/IRN coins).
Update user profile data model to include: userId (161056834), name (survesh bansal), email (mjkjbansal@gmail.com), coins (USDT/IRN), and role (user/admin). Admin username: survesh1.

Add a Withdraw Requests system: each request has requestId, userId, amount (‚Çπ100 / ‚Çπ100000), upiId, and status (pending/approved). Build an admin.html or admin panel page to manage/approve withdrawal requests.

Extend the backend UserProfile data type to include the following additional fields: userId (Nat, auto-incremented or assigned), name (Text), coins (record with usdt: Float and irn: Float fields), and role (variant #user / #admin). Update registerUser, getMyProfile, updateProfile, getAllUsers, and updateUserProfile endpoints to handle these new fields. The hardcoded admin username must be 'survesh1'.
